channel.title: Notes on Alexey Gornostaev
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on Alexey Gornostaev

item.title: The Wizard and the Prophet
item.description: I remember reading a book about two scientists who, while recognizing and agreeing on problems that our planet and the environment faces, had diametrically opposed views on possible solutions.

item.title: Case study: fixing DAU conversion
item.description: It’s quite rare when an update in user flow can lead to a huge change in one of the key metrics. Even more surprising when the changed screen is a standard one, widely used in the industry.

item.title: Whimsical cars
item.description: Every year modern cars look more and more aggressive. This is Nissan Qashqai from 2008 to 2023. The car is bigger, the headlights are narrower, the front grille more prominent.

item.title: Gig workers are contemporary XX century factory workers
item.description: My kid studies in a Russian online school. All classes are remote, 2 hours each, with 4 to 6 kids in a single class.

item.title: Linux is simpler than macOS
item.description: How far we’ve come that window management on modern Linux is simpler and more straightforward than in macOS. In GNOME 42 all you need to learn is how to summon the Activities overview mode via hitting a button with a mouse or pressing a single (“super” by default) key.

item.title: The ephemerality of mobile software
item.description: I’ve playedthrough Loom, a classic Lucas Arts adventure game, and it was fantastic to experience a 30 year old work of interactive software, that is easily playable today and has aged so gracefully.

item.title: What web3 and NFT could mean for video games
item.description: I’ve been thinking about what could web3 and NFTs mean for video games. And, honestly, I can’t make myself to feel excited about the current crop of P2E games.

item.title: Building a PC
item.description: Custom PC builds have come a long way since that last time I assembled my own PC, which was more than ten years ago.

item.title: On instant games
item.description: I get to know the best games from my 13-year-old daughter. Personally I mostly prefer uncool niche video games, but I get very excited when I learn about a game, that is played by every second kid in the neighbourhood, because these are the games that sometimes lead to dramatic changes in the industry.

item.title: Axie Infinity's economy is based on humans who do computer work
item.description: This pay-to-earn Axie Infinity thing is curious, making a lot of money and you’ll absolutely hear about it soon from every corner of the internet.
